About Subscribe

Ryunosuke O'Neil

Particle Physics PhD student

I am a Postgraduate (PhD) researcher at the University of Edinburgh Particle Physics Experiment Group, working on the LHCb Experiment based at the Large Hadron Collider, CERN.

Until September 2020, I was a Postgraduate MSc Research student at the University of Manchester, where I worked on Detector Alignment for the Mu2e Experiment at Fermilab.

A big part of what I do in my research involves the analysis of large quantities of data e.g. acquired by the LHCb detector. I am a motivated programmer and regularly contribute to software, where I can. My GitHub and my CERN GitLab profile display some of my recent software contributions.

A big part of what I do in my research involves the analysis of large quantities of data e.g. acquired by the LHCb detector. I regularly contribute to software and software projects within my experiment. My CERN GitLab and GitHub (to a lesser extent) profiles display some of my recent software contributions. I have also been involved in detector R&D for LHCb Upgrade-II, working with HV Monolithic Active Pixel Sensors (HV-MAPS).

Conference/Workshop attendance and talks

ICHEP 2022 Bologna, Italy (poster)

CERN School of Computing Krakow, Poland (workshop)

VERTEX 2022 Tateyama, Japan (talk)

LHCb-UK Edinburgh, UK (2 talks - closed sessions)

11th Beam Telescopes and Test Beams Workshop Hamburg, Germany (talk)

Latest projects

2021-now LHCb Run 3 software development and commissioning (Data Processing & Analysis Project)

2021-now Detector R&D, LHCb Upgrade-II (Mighty Tracker Project)

2020-now Charm physics analyses at LHCb

2019-20 Data-driven Alignment of the Tracker for the Mu2e Experiment with cosmic rays

2019-20 Continuous integration tools for the Mu2e Offline Software (see Mu2e/Offline)
